name: convolvulus
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a plant with trumpet-shaped flowers (= wider at one end) that twists around other plants as it grows, sometimes grown for its flowers and sometimes growing wild as a weed (= a plant that is not wanted): Trailing blue convolvulus blends well with the softer colours of the herbs. The path became overgrown with honeysuckle, convolvulus, and brambles. Synonym
morning gloryCompare
bindweed
More examplesFewer examplesAvoid soils contaminated with the really tough weeds such as horse tail, ground elder, coltsfoot and convolvulus.The canal towpath can offer a colourful assortment of vetch, convolvulus and purple lupins.Art nouveau spread like convolvulus across the globe.Luxuriant vegetation covers the island, masses of yellow flowers, lilac-coloured papilionaceoe, and mauve convolvuluses.
